basics.name: Kevin Li
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Software engineer with a passion for problem solving, an eye for detail, and a strong mathematics background. Well organized, prompt, attentive and works well within a team or on solo projects. Interested in being part of innovative and technically challenging projects. Always looking for ways to improve as an engineer, eager to learn, and responsive to criticism.

work.summary: Offerpop is a User Generated Content Marketing platform.
highlights: Technologies: Python, Django, Selenium, Javascript, AngularJS, ReactJS, NodeJS, CSS, Less, Bootstrap, Material UI, HTML, Apache, Vagrant, Docker, MySQL, MongoDB
Created new features to increase the platform value for clients and improve the client experience.
Improved the platform's client onboarding process and user interface experience to drive higher engagement with the platform.
Maintained, updated, improved, and refactored existing legacy code.
Wrote user acceptance and unit tests
JIRA, Slack, and GitHub was used to manage and organize workflow processes.
Travis and Jenkins was used for continuous integration testing.
Worked in a team of software engineers.

work.summary: PivotalPath is a hedge fund advisory business.
highlights: Helped build and design the codebase from scratch.
Technologies: Python, Django, Java, Javascript, CSS, Bootstrap, HTML, MySQL, SQLite, Apache, Nginx, Amazon Web Services.
Worked closely with the financial team in creating tools for streamlining their research effort.
Developed a client facing website for clients to access the financial team's research material.
Developed an internal website used the financial team used to organize and manage with their research process.
Setup and maintained the cloud infrastructure responsible for hosting PivotalPath's services.
JIRA, Confluence, HipChat, and GitHub to manage and organize workflow processes.
Worked in a team of software engineers.

work.summary: The Hospital Information Services Department of Maimonides Medical Center was responsible for maintaining the medical records of the patients at the Maimonides Medical Center. This included tasks such as identifying incomplete records, ensuring the results of tests and procedures were associated with the correct record, and acquiring the necessary approval or signatures from the appropriate physicians.
highlights: Identified medical records that were missing physician signatures or reviews.
Assisted physicians in locating their patient's medical records.
